definition: to perform conjuring tricks/to conjure/to juggle
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Or a juggler hates a shove.
They were watching me as they would watch a conjurer about to perform a trick.
sentences.chinese: 他們看着我，就想看着魔術師變戲法一樣。

sentences.english: Juggling with four clubs requires mastering the three-club juggle.
sentences.chinese: 有四支球隊雜耍需要掌握三個俱樂部變戲法。

sentences.english: Broiled chicken disappeared from before us like magic.
sentences.chinese: 燒雞像變戲法似地從我們眼前消失了。

sentences.english: The juggler was the amazement of the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 變戲法者使市民們歎爲觀止。

sentences.english: I started doing tricks for the kids at school.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我開始在學校裏給其他孩子變戲法。

sentences.english: Please give me your bag and the juggler in it. I will give you a package of gold coins for it.
sentences.chinese: 請把你的口袋和口袋裏那個變戲法的給我吧。

sentences.english: They brought back to my mind, in a flash, the thr juggles .
sentences.chinese: 他們頓時使我回想起那三個變戲法的。

sentences.english: Only when a juggler misses catching his ball does he appeal to me.
sentences.chinese: 只在一個變戲法的人接不到球的時候，他才能吸引我。

sentences.english: The old man conjured up a bag of silver coins from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 老人像變戲法似的從衣袋裏掏出一包銀幣。

sentences.english: They brought back to my mind, in a flash , the three juggles.
sentences.chinese: 他們頓時使我回想起那三個變戲法的。

sentences.english: He is good at conjuring with silver coins.
Sometimes, he made himself an illusionist and played tricks on me.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，他把他自己變成魔術師，對我變戲法。

sentences.english: The conjurer used magic to produce a dove from his hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔術家用變戲法從帽子裏變出一隻鴿子。

sentences.english: Thus somehow the bitterness of a parting was juggled away.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，離愁別恨總算變戲法似的變掉了。

sentences.english: Why don't you ask the juggler?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不問問你那個變戲法的呢？

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
lingering fear
equestrianism/horsemanship
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to hoodwink/to deceive/to dupe sb
belt (in trousers)/CL:根[gen1]
sullen/to scowl miserably
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
